128 struct RunInfo
129 {
130  // the current testing id
131  chaos::str::UTF8String id;
132  // whether the tests should be run in a single process or not
133  bool single_proc;
134  // whether the test is being run as a sub-process of a parent testing
135  // process
136  bool sub_proc;
137  // the paths to the tests to run
138  std::set< chaos::str::UTF8String > paths;
139  // whether the standard output stream is being used
140  bool use_stdout;
141  // information for stdout
142  OutInfo stdout_info;
143  // mapping from file path to write to, to the format to use
144  std::map< chaos::str::UTF8String, OutInfo* > files;
145 
146  RunInfo()
147  :
148  single_proc( false ),
149  sub_proc ( false ),
150  use_stdout ( true ),
151  stdout_info( 3, TestLogger::OUT_PRETTY_TEXT )
152  {
153  }
154 };

162 class TestCore
163 {
164 public:
165 
166  //-------------------------PUBLIC STATIC ATTRIBUTES-------------------------
167 
168  static TestLogger logger;
169  static std::map< chaos::str::UTF8String, UnitTest* > test_map;
170  static std::set< chaos::str::UTF8String > base_modules;

172  static chaos::str::UTF8String current_module;
173 
174  //-------------------------------CONSTRUCTOR--------------------------------
175 
183  TestCore(
184  const chaos::str::UTF8String& path,
185  UnitTest* unit_test,
186  const chaos::str::UTF8String& file,
187  chaos::int32 line,
188  bool module = false,
189  RunInfo* run_info = NULL )
190  {
191  // TODO: try - catch
192 
193  // run tests
194  if ( run_info )
195  {
196  TestCore::setup( run_info );
197  TestCore::run( run_info );
198  TestCore::teardown( run_info );
199  return;
200  }
201 
202  // module declaration
203  if ( module )
204  {
205  TestCore::declare_module( path, file, line );
206  return;
207  }
208 
209  // unit declaration
210  TestCore::declare_unit( path, unit_test, file, line );
211  }
212 
213 private:
214

319 #define CHAOS_TEST_MODULE( path ) \
320  namespace \
321  { \
322  chaos::test::internal::TestCore t( #path, NULL, "", 0, true ); \
323  }
324 
330 #define CHAOS_TEST_UNIT( path ) \
331  CHAOS_TEST_UNIT_FIXTURE( path, chaos::test::Fixture )
332 
338 #define CHAOS_TEST_UNIT_FIXTURE( path, fixture_type ) \
339  struct path : public chaos::test::internal::UnitTest \
340  { \
341  fixture_type* fixture; \
342  path() : UnitTest( #path ), fixture( new fixture_type() ){} \
343  virtual ~path(){ delete fixture; } \
344  virtual chaos::test::Fixture* get_fixture() { return fixture; } \
345  virtual void execute(); \
346  }; \
347  static chaos::test::internal::TestCore object_##path ( \
348  #path, new path(), __FILE__, __LINE__ ); \
349  void path::execute()
350 
351 
357 #define CHAOS_CHECK_EQUAL( a, b ) \
358  if ( a == b ) \
359  { \
360  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger.report_check_pass( \
361  "CHAOS_CHECK_EQUAL", __FILE__, __LINE__ ); \
362  } \
363  else \
364  { \
365  chaos::str::UTF8String f_e_m; \
366  f_e_m << a << " does not equal " << b; \
367  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger.report_check_fail( \
368  "CHAOS_CHECK_EQUAL", __FILE__, __LINE__, f_e_m ); \
369  }
370
